thread.title: H.S. girls soccer: Dynamic duo power Pascack Hills - Girls Soccer
thread.title_full: H.S. girls soccer: Dynamic duo power Pascack Hills - Girls Soccer - NorthJersey.com

author: The Record
title: H.S. girls soccer: Dynamic duo power Pascack Hills - Girls Soccer
text:
Buy this photo Amy newman/staff photographer Pascack Hills players swarm Erica Bardes, center, after the junior scored the game-winning goal. Pascack Hills coach Scott Ernest looked at his team at halftime. His Cowgirls sat nearby a disheartening scoreboard that showed upset-minded Midland Park ahead by two.
"But they had that look in their eye," Ernest said of his team in the middle of its first round Bergen County girls soccer tournament game in Montvale.
"I was just thinking to myself, ‘These guys are not going to go down this easy.’ And in the second half, we got to it."
Specifically, Pascack Hills’ Allison Ernest and Erica Bardes got to it.
The pair of junior playmakers led the 14th-seeded Cowgirls’ second-half charge en route to a 3-2 overtime win against 19th-seeded Midland Park.
Ernest cut the Cowgirls’ deficit in half and Bardes tied it with 17 minutes left off an Ernest assist. Three minutes into extra time, Bardes struck again, ripping a hard, arcing shot from 20 yards out to ignite a wild celebration and cap the comeback.
"As Midland Park was walking off, I said to the girls, ‘We’ve been on that side, we know how that feels,’’’ said Ernest, whose team was 0-2 in OT games this season. "I think they were motivated to make sure it didn’t happen again. We showed a lot of character. We showed a lot of poise. Past experiences kind of helped us get through this one."
Pascack Hills goalie Mackenzie Catherwood made six saves in the win for the Cowgirls, who will meet No. 3 Ramapo in the round of 16.
No. 24 LYNDHURST 2, No. 9 INDIAN HILLS 0 (at Oakland): Mia Luna scored twice in the first half, both off assists from Gabrielle Carrion, as the 24th-seeded Bears knocked off the ninth-seeded Braves in the biggest upset of the first round. It marked the program’s first county tournament win in 11 years, as Lyndhurst (8-1) keeper Izzy Castagnetti made 13 saves for the shutout. The Bears will meet No. 8 Paramus next.
No. 1 NORTHERN HIGHLANDS 7, No. 32 DWIGHT-ENGLEWOOD 0 (at Allendale): Freshman Claudia Dipasupil scored twice and Morgan Busacca struck once and added three assists.
No. 8 PARAMUS 2, No. 25 HASBROUCK HEIGHTS 0 (at Paramus): Senior Julia Koenemund scored both goals for the Spartans, each off assists from Lorraine Moffitt, while Nicole DiPasquale needed to make just two saves for the shutout.
No. 5 MAHWAH 8, No. 28 NORTH ARLINGTON 0 (at Mahwah): Seven players scored for the Thunderbirds and Sarah Jordan led the way with a pair of goals and three assists. Nikki Roberts added one goal and two assists.
No. 13 PARK RIDGE 4, No. 20 NEW MILFORD 0 (at Park Ridge): Mikaela Heyboer, Madeline Clancy, Claire Perez and Nicole Thomas all scored for the Owls (8-0-1) in a battle of Group 1 unbeatens.
No. 3 RAMAPO 7, No. 30 BERGENFIELD (at Franklin Lakes): Nikki Butler and Allison Stagg both scored twice and Cami Pecore, Sarah Scire and Emily Ramsden added one goal.
No. 6 RIVER DELL 2, No. 27 HACKENSACK 1 (at Oradell): Katelyn Gillies and Julie McGovern scored for the Golden Hawks, who were tied at 1 at halftime. Alison Sorkenn made six saves for the shutout.
No. 10 NV/OLD TAPPAN 5, No. 23 WESTWOOD 0 (at Old Tappan): Amanda Tripodi scored twice and assisted on two others and leading scorer Kelly Walsh added two more goals for the Golden Knights. Emily Crevani provided one goal and two assists and Maia Levenshus and Jada Usal combined for the shutout with two saves each.
No. 15 FAIR LAWN 4, No. 18 DEMAREST 0 (at Fair Lawn): Victoria Telewiak scored once and added two assists and Eleni Gabbia, Lisa Kestelboym and Dana Zamir all added one goal for the Cutters.
No. 2 IMMACULATE HEART 6, No. 31 WOOD-RIDGE 0 (at Washington): Julia Raith scored twice and added one assist, Victoria Muller provided a goal and an assist and Alexa Buffa, McKenzie Kilduff and Julianna Shrekgast all provided one goal for IHA, which will meet Fair Lawn in the round of 16.
No. 12 RIDGEWOOD 3, No. 21 TENAFLY 0 (at Ridgewood): The Maroons climbed back to .500 (5-5-1) with their third straight win, getting two goals from Alexa Maltz and one from Riley Ricciardi.
No. 7 RAMSEY 5, No. 26 TEANECK 0 (at Ramsey): Corinne Kropas scored twice and Olivia Gilligan, Meredith Edwards and Cassie Phillips added one for the Rams, who improved to 9-1 with their eighth straight win.
No. 11 PASCACK VALLY 3, No. 22 CLIFFSIDE PARK 0 (at Hillsdale): Arianna Quevado, Elizabeth Spadafino and Kelly Petro all struck for one goal for the Indians and Gina Criscuolo made three saves in the shutout.
